item.title: Probability Mass Function (Pmf)
item.description: PMF for a disscrete random variable X: $p(X)$ Mean (Expectation) *the sum of the weighted possible values of X (sum of $p(X=x)x$ ) Tip $$\mu = E[X] = \sum_{x} x p(X=x)$$ Variance measure the spread of a PMF (Average Squared Distance from the mean) Tip $$\sigma^2 = Var[X] = E[(X-\mu)^2] = E[(X-E[X])^2] = E[X^2] - (E[X])^2$$ calculation: using the expected value rules: $$Var[X] = E[(X-\mu)^2] = E[g(x)] = \sum_x g(x)p(X=x) = \sum_x (x-\mu)^2p(X=x) $$ Info $$Var[X] = \sum_x (x-\mu)^2p(X=x) $$ $$Var[X] = E[(X-\mu)^2] = E[X^2 - 2X\mu + \mu^2] $$ $$Var[X] = E[(X-\mu)^2] = E[X^2] - 2\mu E[X] + \mu^2 $$ $$Var[X] = E[X^2] - 2 (E[X])^2 + E[X]^2 $$ Info $$Var[X] = E[X^2] - (E[X])^2 $$ References [1] https://socratic.
